oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Induction of a T Helper 1 Immune Response with an Inactivated Viral Vaccine
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chase, C. C. L.
Young, A.
Zimmerman, A.
Gilkerson, K.
Barling, K.
Scholz, D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bovine viral diarrhea virus
BVDV
reproductive disease
respiratory disease
T helper 1
vaccines
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine viral diarrhea virus (BVDV) is a major pathogen of cattle causing severe respiratory and reproductive disease. BVDV vaccines remain an important part of the control strategy. Inactivated vaccines have been often characterized as evoking only a humoral antibody response with little opportunity for memory. It has been well established that a good cell mediated response and memory requires a T helper 1 (TH1) response. In this study we measure the T helper 1 response in cattle vaccinated with Virashield.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2008; 276
